column5: Hopefully todays Sat. pics will be clear of clouds,should all be gone in a day or so now. Good timing anyway ahead of last yr.
Todays sat pics show Hebert clear of ice Hit that one on the head.
We get it you guessed right.
??? link please. thxs

http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/mod...egion=g&page=1 Top right side of pics you can also scroll back a few days and watch the progress. I know this is great news to you guys going in for the opener Kia as a guest I really do not care if you get it or not. I have been doing this type of posting a long time. Try to be a little more courteous to our members. I think you will find most members very helpful .

I see nothing but cloud over Gouin on May 10 imagery. I am sure the ice is gone but I don't see how you can tell. ( Of course I have no clue where Lake Herbert is...lol. I know it is not part of the reservoir system.)

Hebert is visable in one of the pics., I stay in contact with my outfitter about the gouin its ice out. Hebert is 40 miles northwest of the Gouin. Those who booked opening week will be able to go. My crew is 40 days out of flyin to Hebert Prime time.
Hi Ron, I asked for link because all I see is clouds too. But you're right the ice is gone. About 28 days for me...torture time, lol. FT
todays sat pics very clear NOT A SNOWBALL IN SIGHT
Don't try the auger while in the boat eh!
ice went out yesterday on south bay of gullrock
Ice out is progressing very quickly now, My prediction of on or before the 10th is spot on

Ron, I hope you're right...the early birds are going to find a light walleye bite but the pike should be good. I do know that this year the ice was thicker. I'm trying to find out about the Gouin water levels also, some pics looks like a low level. Back in 2003 spring, the Gouin was down 20ft in the spring. Heavy electric use due to a very cold winter that year was the culprit. Low water does shorten the search area...as long as you can reach all the locations. FT
did not get any clear sat pictures on the area today to cloudy
Above normal temps forcast for the next two weeks. Next good satelite pic will tell the story
Its ice out at the Clova Plane base The Gouin and Hebert are not far behind
The fly in company posted a picture yesterday showing they had just got their floatplanes in the water.
The west end of the gouin is ice free,a few more days and it will all be free, Hebert is still covered, My prediction is for the 10-th or sooner, I have to say I was spot on
http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/mod...egion=g&page=1 Check out 5/7 2015 15:43 gmt The gouin was about 50% free Hebert 98% frozen
Good news Pat! Good thing you already have your trip planned!

Absolutely , but I would have made the drive to pick up my fabulous prize from V-Bay even if I wasn't spending time there this summer!!! This is quite an award of the highest distinction......don't ya know? If you win the Brace Lake Contest this year you'll be the luckiest guy I know since you already won your trip to BBL a few years ago. If you do win, I would love to hear the discussion between you and the wife ......" Ummm, honey, I've got some good news and some bad news." "Would you like the good news or bad news first ?" PjShorthorn
Hawk Lake (20 miles East of Lake of the Woods) ice out May 1st, 3 weeks earlier than last year. At 440 feet deep it is always one of the last lakes in the area to go. -FT

That would be a great problem to deal with! For the record, I have won three trips. The first was at work, took the wife and son to Bannf BC for a ski trip. Second trip, my wife and I went to Rome, and the Black Bear trip. For a free trip, she just might go along, as long as the cabins have indoor plumbing!

With your luck I would plan ahead.. Cabelas has their camp commode chair on sale. Just set it up inside the cabin. It looks pretty lightweight so it wouldn't cut into the weight limit too much. Be advised, the 5 gal. bucket is not included but the toliet seat is PjShorthorn

I think you are spot on with your prediction. Looking at the sat pics today there is open water near the dam for sure and looks like possible open areas else where. I was way off by saying closer to the 20th.
You're only renting the cabin....why do you need a bucket?
You might need the bucket for the boat!
Just got a report that the ice is moving out on Eva lake.

To your point,since the ice is out you won't mind if I borrow an ice auger with an extension would you? Drill a hole through the cabin floor, set up chair, presto..........problem solved and probable crisis averted. PjShorthorn.
http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/mod...egion=g&page=1 Try this one upper right hand corner
some rivers around the gouin a clearly flowing snow pac is gone
just out at cedar today.still ice but it is black.guessin few more days and its gone.checked out the rapids(east end) walleyes are spawning.
I have been using the Hidden Bay Lodge site for a couple years of to watch the ice melt away. They post pictures of Lakes in Sioux Lookout and LOW.http://www.hiddenbay.com/icewatch.html

Congratulations to PJ Shorthorn for being the "Ice Out Winner" for the coveted Vermilion Bay championship! Ice has officially departed the scene as of May 1, 2015. http://www.electricbeaver.ca/fishing...-are-outraged/

In case no one has posted this site, for you guys that like to watch for the ice out, go to this website. It will show you areas as far as just north of Sturgeon Lake and as of today, Sturgeon and Nipigon are still ice covered. If you zoom in you can pick out many more lakes. Its cool info.http://ge.ssec.wisc.edu/modis-today/ Im heading to Nungesser 5/29 and I think its still ice covered.

Being crowned the King of the 2015 Eagle Lake Ice Out contest is the highlight of the year for me ( well, Ok the day, maybe just the next hour, ummmm probably just right now ) You can read my acceptance speech on the Electric Beaver Blog..........unless the blog Mod has nuked it due to possible inappropriate comments referencing chaps.. Back to tying up my River Monster Spinners. PjShorthorn
Anyone have information on the Hearst Area. Hopefull to fly in for the opener. We were frozen out last spring. Thanks for the help?
Anyone have information on the Hearst Area. Hopefull to fly in for the opener. We were frozen out last spring. Thanks for the help?

When I speak of ice out I'm talking about 49 degrees north or farther north, Yesterdays sat pics clearly show even small streams are ice free.It will not be long now, Your walleyes will be in spawning mod for the opener.Pike are ready to rock and roll in shallow water
Hopefully you boat in but last year around our outfitter the ice didn't come out until around May 20th. Hoping this year with less snow you will be good. We head up on the 23rd.
it will be ice out on the gouin by the opener
Ice gone by the May15th will be iffy this spring. I'd be more concerned with a good walleye bite on the Gouin for the opener. All spawning areas are off limits until May30th. Good luck anyway.
Any information on the ice conditions/predictions for the Perrault Falls area? I'll be heading that way on May 23rd and I'm sure it will be gone, just wondering how soon. Thanks!

I'm with Freytown. May 15th is going to be close. I am leaning more towards the same as last year (around the 20-22). If you look at the forecasted temps compared to last year they are lower and the amount of snow still on the ground in southern Quebec still leads me to think it will be later. I know LOTW is almost ice free now but that is about 650 miles as the crow flies to the west. To offer some perspective I am about 500 miles east of Gouin and we are going to be at least a month behind on ice out. Of course we go through this every year and no one really knows. Just hope everyone's trip is the best they have had to date!
With the next 14 day outlook at temps in Quebec, I'm going to stick my neck out and say the ice will be gone on the gouin by or before the 10th of May, 10 days before last yr.
almost all the snow pac is gone, I stick to my prediction no ice on the gouin by the 10th, its going to be close
if you check satelite pics from a week ago ,compared to today. not such a bright white any more
Where do you find up to date satellite pics?
http://lance-modis.eosdis.nasa.gov/i...subset=Chapais You need a clear sky to see the earth features. If it's cloudy you won't see anything.
Snow is reseeding quickly,I'm guessing ice out in northern quebec to be one week earlier than last yr. two week outlook is for above normal temps
Red Wing Lodge on LOW has a webcam, their bay looked open!
LOTW Stevens Bay open per Young's Wilderness Camp
Hanson Bay and the small bays out of Morson are all open water! Ice should be completely off our part of the lake within a few days.
I went and checked Cordingley again this morning, had 20.5" with a couple inches of water in between layers. We had 34" last Saturday, its going fast.

The melt is going to slow down this week, judging by the long range forecast. I'm sticking with my prediction of May 5th for the central basin of Lac Seul. The NW and SE parts of the lake will go out 5-7 days before the central basin.
long range forcast is for above normal temps,staying above freezing at night as well, first week of may is looking better

Talked to the owners of the camp (Indian Lake Lodge) that we've been going to for 15 years, they say ice out in 3-5 days at most, ice is black and decaying fast, if it would have stayed warm this week, the ice would have been gone by the weekend,,,,,, sooo that is always ggod news!!!! Indian Lake Lodge is just north of Vermilion Bay ON. Take Care
Strong winds can make a big difference in influencing the breakup, if the wind up there is anything like we have had down here in Ioway, it shouldn't take too much longer! Bill
We are heading up to Gouin May 14th for the opening - not sure if we are boating or walking in
Shebs did have more, but say 36" or so. And it was terrible ice, the first half was slush and water.
A few guys just returned from lac 40 ish inches was the general consensus .
The next 14 days are going to be above normal temps, During The day in the 40's and just under freezing at night.Ice should start to reseed and be gone by may 1 in the great north
weather channel says high of 70 tomorrow and lows in the 40's now thru Sunday. That should get things melting

Got out this morning for probably the last time for lake trout.was kinda shocked when the auger went through, maybe had 18".whoa.lot of ice disappeared since last week.after we got our trout we headed for some crappieaction and the ice there was worse.left at 2 and the surface was real sloppy.with the temps staying warm it isnt going to be long.one thing it hasnt done is pulled away from the shoreline.going to get my boat ready so that when the oppurtunity comes ill be ready to launch it somewhere.

I wish you are right Ron, but I think this year may be later than last year. The locals on the Gouin are esti May 15 (earliest) but May 20 more likely. Not a good year for the early birds in the Clova area.

Here is a link I use to see what is happening with ice out:http://lance-modis.eosdis.nasa.gov/i...roject=aeronetNasa takes a pic every day but it is limited by the amount of cloud cover on that day. I like using the True Color Terra which is an actual photo and also the 3-6-7 Terra as the red in the photo is the ice cover on the bodies of water (both 250m). I use this to look at the Gouin but if you want to look at other areas click on the " Return to Aeronet" title and look for the area you want( warning this map is very busy with lots of areas to view so some patience is required to find your area). Hope this helps!

For anyone flying out of Nakina, I just drilled on Cordingley and there is 26" total, and 8" of that is pure water under 2" of ice. Last year on May 5 we still had 20" with no water so I would say we are well ahead of last year. Last years ice out on Cordingley was May 19.
Just looked at the web cam at red wing lodge in morson Ontario and there's a lot of open water showing up. Won't be long on lake of the woods in that area.

Here are a few links to updates in the Sioux Lookout area... A pool betting on the day the barrel sinks through the ice: Endofwinter.ca Pilot pictures of the ice from above:https://icepatrol.wordpress.com

Ice out in remote camps looks to be the same as last yr. We need a good warm april to start to thaw the lakes of the great north, Western temps have been above normal most of the winter, In the east it still remains below normal

We are well ahead of normal here. We will be close to being able to fish walleyes from our boats at the top end of Lake of the Woods before the season closes on April 15. We normally are able to fish the Keewatin Channel here if spring comes early. Warm rain last night and nice temps this week. I burnt the grass in my yard (south facing slope) a week ago here in Kenora.
Watching the daily Satilite pics of the great lakes and northern ont,que, No soft water yet
Where do you get up to date satellite photos? Thanks -- GO BUCKY!

Looks like Wednesday night it starts staying above 0.and some good warm days coming.we have around 30" of ice on most of our lakes in the vermilion bay area.lakes are free of snow and are glare ice.will get some more ice fishing in for a while yet before it starts pulling away from shore.basically going to be a normal ice out for a change.
So much for the warm weather huh! April 25 th?????? Not a chance my friend.

Yup it got chilly again.The ice may not be totally off by then, but it's supposed to warm up for real at the end of this week.I can usually get to my place as the channels open up first.As a matter of fact it's already possible to get through already as far as the Tangle Islands according to the ice patrol photos.https://icepatrol.wordpress.com/I have a boathouse in town that is free of ice already.I just need Holmstroms March to open up to get through to my place on Wolf.
things are much different there with the currents and such, still 4 feet here in Thunder Bay.

I fished Greenwater and Shebandowan, just west of Thunder Bay last weekend and there was nowhere near 4ft. I would say closer to 30", the auger blades just into the ice to break through on Greenwater, a little more on Shebandowan. Around Nakina we have less ice than usual this year. I haven't measured but I would say not more than 3ft.

My friend fished dog lake last weekend and gave me this info, and walleye Wayne just returned from lad des Mille lac, and confirmed the ice depth. Deep water lake trout lakes generally have less ice as they take longer to freeze over, surprised shebandowan only has 30 inches.
what is your prediction for ice out on Lac Seul on the north west end by Ear Falls? Will the ice be out by May 16th?
Yeap. I'm saying may 7th.
early this year
Party foul ! No talking about ice out prior to April..... You just HAD to go there didn't ya? LOL
The temp has "soared" above freezing here and everything is melting.I predict ice out by the 25th of April if not sooner.
Oops I was unaware of the April 1st rule on questioning Ice Out times. We got our melt on here in Iowa. I could be on open water within a couple weeks.
The very nice gentleman who monitors the ice melt on Lake of the Woods has started his reports for 2015. His theme so far seems to be "Don't Hold Your Breath." https://icepatrol.wordpress.com/
Just got back from lotw, 47" of ice is goin no where fast
We've had a bit of a heat wave here.I've not seen weather this warm this early that I can recall.It was 50 degrees here yesterday.I expected another month of freezing weather.
Had some rain yesterday and plus double digit temps this weekend might help speed things up.
